title: Error "Cannot interpret QR code" in "Transfer accounts". How do I transfer my codes all at once?
content:
I have a new Pixel 4a and an LG G6 both with version 5.10 of Authenticator.

On the LG G6 I tap the three dots in the upper right hand corner and tap Transfer accounts. I then am able to tap Export accounts, and I enter my pin. With all the checks selected I tap Next and am given 2 QR codes.

On the Pixel 4a I tap Get Started and tap "Import existing accounts?" at the bottom right of the screen(although tapping "Scan a QR code" brings me to the same cross hairs that end in the same result). I tap "Scan QR code" and line up the phones. 

The Pixel 4a vibrates and scans the first QR code and I tap "Next" on the LG G6 to get the second QR code. The Pixel 4a  vibrates again and shows a shield and message that says "Error", "Cannot interpret QR code". And the only option is to tap "Okay". That takes me back to where I would tap the three dots.

I have tried multiple brightness's on the LG G6 which has a really good resolution(ppi) with no cracks in the screen, and even took the screen protector off thinking that might be the problem. I know the pixel 4a has a good camera so that can't be the problem. I have more than a dozen code that I need to transfer so I'd like to not have to do them one by one.

Why isn't this working?
category: Setting up and Personalizing your Device, Google Pixel 4a
